name: Finally, A  Perfect Fried Chicken Recipe
description: Like fried chicken? Like it better cold but hate it when the yummy crust falls off? This is my  years-in-the-making  recipe that keeps the crust on, even when cold! Great for picnics!!!
recipeIngredient: 6 chicken leg quarters, cut into thighs and drumsticks
1 cup vegetable oil for frying, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken thighs and drumsticks into a bowl and pour buttermilk over chicken. Stir to coat. Cover and marinate in refrigerator for 3 hours (or up to overnight).
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Place flour, onion powder, garlic powder, seasoned salt, chicken bouillon granules, sage, black pepper, thyme, and marjoram into a 1-gallon resealable plastic bag. Close bag and shake to combine flour and seasonings. Whisk eggs and milk in a large bowl.
Pour vegetable oil into a cast-iron skillet or an oven-safe glass or metal pan. Heat skillet with oil in the hot oven for 10 minutes.

While oil is heating, drain buttermilk from chicken pieces and place each chicken piece into plastic bag of seasoned flour. Seal bag and shake to coat chicken piece with seasoned flour. Dip each coated piece in egg mixture, then return the piece to the bag of flour mixture and shake to coat a second time. Place coated chicken pieces onto a plate to rest for 5 minutes to set coating.

Place coated chicken into hot oil in the skillet and bake for 30 minutes. Turn chicken over and bake until no longer pink inside and the coating is golden brown, about 20 more minutes. Place chicken pieces on a rack to drain oil before serving.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Finally, A  Perfect Fried Chicken Recipe

review.reviewBody: The chicken itself was very juicy.  Unfortunately the crust fell off after it was out of the oven, and didn't have much of a flavor and the crust was a bit bland

A huge disappointment.  The chicken itself was OK but the breading stuck to the bottom of the pan when I turned IIt and what remained was not very flavorful.  If you're looking for the perfect fried chicken, this is not it.  My quest continues.

I had 12 boneless/skinless chicken thighs so I altered the amounts to reflect this. I scaled to 2 servings to use 1 cup buttermilk in a ziploc bag and added all the seasonings except for the seasoning salt I used Mrs Dash garlic & herb. I let the chicken soak all day it the milk mixture in the fridge. For the flour I used 1 cup in a ziploc bag and added the seasonings again as above. I skipped the egg step I just shook the chicken pieces in the flour ziploc bag until totally covered. I fried the chicken thighs 2 minutes each side then kept them in a 350 degree oven while I was getting the rest of dinner prepared. I served with mashed potatoes corn and sawmill gravy my family really enjoyed this the chicken was super tender and flavourful. #AllrecipesAllstarsCanada #FacelessNoMore

Made it... loved it. If your food is sticking to a cast iron skillet it’s not seasoned properly I changed the ingredients on this recipe to my liking. I don’t use butter milk I use heavy whipping cream eggs flour and Kellogg’s crumbles.
I used our copper chef pans and added a few other spices and it came out great, no sticking to the pan and plenty of flavor!
